Reviews.Title: “It met our needs.”
Reviews.Author: Houndsbaseballfan
Reviews.Content: We came to Phoenix to watch spring training games, so we were not at the hotel much during the week we were here. However, the hotel met our needs for what we wanted it to do. It was centrally located, near several restaurants, easy to get to, and appeared to be in a fair part of town. The breakfasts had a good selection except that they ran out of stuff a couple of days. I realize that can happen, but it seems like you would anticipate this when the hotel is full and "stock up". The nights were relatively quiet. The front desk staff was helpful. John (at the front desk) was particularly helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: soccercrazy4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a 2QB suite (extended room with couch). The room had a medium size frig (not one of those tiny cubes!), microwave, and room for food storage. The room was quite spacious. The beds were new, but too soft for my taste - although my daughter loved them! We requested a room on the top floor away from the elevator & ice machine AND they were more than accomodating! We interacted with more than 5 front desk staff and ALL were extremely nice and helpful. The breakfast is hot with a very nice selection for the whole family. The hotel itself is off a quiet street, but adjacent to I-17. I was worried at first, but the windows seemed soundproof and we did not hear any of the interstate traffic noise. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area. It's a great bargin!! (yes, there is a $1.50 in-room safe fee, but they removed the charge when I said I wasn't going to use it).

Reviews.Title: “There is a nicer Comfort Suites in nearby Peoria, AZ”
Reviews.Author: marathon308
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a Sunday night. By a mistake we reserved an accessible room. The room was quite worn out and front desk replaced our room to a better one. We felt as the hotel was almost deserted and that front desk service was mediocre. Free wifi in the room. Breakfast was included. Ample of parking space. Reserved at choicehotels for 80$. On the following night we stayed at another Comfort Suites (in Peoria, AZ, 15 miles away) and enjoyed it over there.

Reviews.Title: “Extra Fee”
Reviews.Author: JLHtravels
Reviews.Content: I was very suprised at check in to see an box stating a $1.50 fee for the in-room safe. I have stayed at hotels all over this country and internationally and never been charged to the In-room safe. The amount is not the issue, just the separate fee. This may be a Choice Hotel Corporate policy, just ALWAYS check what they are charging for.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value”
Reviews.Author: jonbella
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a family event in nearby Mesa. Didn't realize that it was at least a 30 minute drive from Mesa and the family gave me a hard time about that...until we arrived at the hotel and they saw how nice it was and how comfortable and spacious their rooms were. Loved the indoor pool, especially since an outdoor pool would have been too hot in August. Since we brought our two teenagers, it was great that we could have one queen bed, our daughter the other queen bed, and our son the sofa bed. We brought our two little dogs with us and the hotel staff welcomed them, too!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: MSP2SFO
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here only 10 days before I arrived (I had a family memorial service to attend), and was very pleased with every aspect of this hotel! I was very happy to get a AAA rate for less than $60.00 per night (this is the "low" season in Phoenix). The staff were very friendly and helpful. I was very pleased when I was able to check in just before noon on the day I arrived. I have some trouble walking/standing for long periods of time, so I requested a handicap accessible room. It was perfect-the large bathroom and walk-in shower were wonderful! There was also an abundance of nice toiletries and lots of towels! The beds were a bit high but very comfortable with lots of pillows! The room also had a microwave and mini-refrigerator which was greatly appreciated! There was also a safe and iron/ironing board, and coffee maker with lots of coffee. The AC worked great and was adjustable (very important in Phoenix in August!) There was also a computer for guests' use in the lobby, as well as fruit, coffee and newspapers. I loved the complimentary breakfast. It included hot foods (eggs, bacon, sausage), as well as bagels, English muffins and pastries. There are two waffle makers, as well as several kinds of cereal and beverages to choose from. I wasn't too concerned with the location since I was with family and friends during the day; I just wanted to be around the Metro Center area. Just across the parking lot there is a Sweet Tomatoes restaurant (yummy!) and it looked like there were a few other restaurants fairly close to the hotel, including an Outback Steak House. The hotel is located right off of I-17, although the entrance is a couple of blocks off of the freeway. My room was located near the freeway side, but I could barely hear the traffic; it didn't bother me at all. I had a very pleasant experience here and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!! Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: sbdg02
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, the staff is gret & very helpful. Room service is great and the breakfast is great!! Do alot of traveling and this was a great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MakeaGreatDay
Reviews.Content: This was my husbands business trip...but our son & friend came along this time. They enjoyed Castles & Coasters which is so close to the hotel for awesome fun! I purchased discounted ($15.00 each) for all day unlimited rides from Bashes Market...what a great deal that was! So for $30.00 the boys had a full day of fun! Then returned to the hotel to swim! What a perfect location to stay...and the staff were very helpfull & friendly! This is a hotel we will definately be returning to!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: gibsonReeseville
Reviews.Content: Very please with this motel. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Stayed two nights during the week, and felt it was a very good value for the price. Easy access to highway, yet the motel was located on a very quite street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: edpalmore
Reviews.Content: I totally loved this hotel. We went for business but we had to take our children and dog. It was very roomy, quite, clean. Staff was very friendly. The free breakfast was not the best but it was good. We enjoied the free coffee and hot chocolate alot. The indoor pool was nice but a little loud (because it was indoors). The beds were very comfortable. Pillows were a little worn out. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money-- not for service.”
Reviews.Author: NewMexicoFam_of_5
Reviews.Content: As a family of 6 (4 children under the age of 8) it's hard to find a hotel who will take us in. Sure, we could lie and say we only have 4, but I'm a bad liar. So this Comfort Suites deserves some credit for even having a room that can handle my group. Moreover, the price was decent. We paid $113 a night for a 2 bedroom (and 1 sofa pull out). So the price is decent. Families need to be aware that the hotel is in a neighborhood with a lot of street activity. And by street activity, I mean there are shady people roaming the streets at all hours. There was a near constant police presence. This is in no way the hotel's fault, and their security was great. But corners are cut. At check-in we asked to extend our stay a night and night clerk told us we would have to wait until in the morning because she didn't know how to do it. The biggest disappointment was the pull out bed in the sofa. Night One: NO SHEETS in the room for it. Asked the clerk for some the next day. Night two: NO SHEETS. Bottom line: I'd stay there again, but with lowered expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: juno1056
Reviews.Content: My husband and I would like to take this opportunity to thank you and all your staff for making our stay in Phoenix a happy one. You and all your staff were friendly and very helpful. Great place not far to eat. Brian and Janet Thomas

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families with pets.”
Reviews.Author: mykidzmom
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on a "pet friendly" search site. We needed a hotel where we could have our dog, was centrally located and had a room big enough to sleep our family of 5 plus our dog. Comfort Suites at Metro Center fit the bill. The staff was extremely friendly, and when they say "pet friendly" they mean it. There was a minimal one time $25 charge for our pet. There is a dog park walking distance from the hotel (on 25th south of the soccer fields) and also a dog run at the hotel where you can walk your dog (please pick up after your dog to keep dog friendly hotels dog friendly). The pool and hot tub areas were clean and the kids had a blast splashing around. The breakfast consisted of a hot entree (bisuits and gravy or eggs and sausage), you could make your own waffles or you could have the usual continental fare. All in all it was a great stay and I would recommend this hotel to anyone with a family who needs a place to stay in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Lots better”
Reviews.Author: neisi59
Reviews.Content: Found this Hotel/Suite, as very close to I-17. All rooms either face North or South. Suites used has a wet bar, fridge, microwave, and two TV's. King size bed was very comfortable. Front desk is/was very heplful in finding local place, gave great directions. Everyone on my trip was very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Overbooked Even After Providing Credit Card Guarantee”
Reviews.Author: anchorage1977
Reviews.Content: Imagine flying all day, arriving at 10pm and looking forward to getting to bed before work in the morning. Imagine paying $40 for a taxi to your hotel, a hotel you prebooked using a credit card to guarantee your late arrival. Now imagine showing up and finding out you are being "walked" aka forcably moved, to a different hotel. This might be an acceptable practice in the hotel business - greedy to make their buck at the expense of their customers. It is however the worst level of service a hotel can demonstrate. Imagine inviting friends or family over to your house, and then upon their arrival on your porch you ask them to spend the night at the neighbors. It's just rude. Don't support hotels that manage their inventory by overbooking like this. The Comfort Inn Metro Center in Phoenix is such a nasty hotel. It will be a cold day in the desert before I'll ever book with them again... I recommend you avoid this at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “nice but loud”
Reviews.Author: keatingclan
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was great, near shopping and main roads. Unfortutately, if you're on the I-17 side of the hotel you'll have a lot of noise at night. Ask for a room away from the highway.
